text: No. 5 John Street is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Kenelm Foss and starring Zena Dare and Mary Odette and Lionelle Howard.Low p.418 It is based on a novel by Richard Whiteing. The screenplay concerns a soap-making heiress who disguises herself as a worker. ==Plot summary== A soap-making heiress disguises herself as a worker and gets employment at her own family's factory to find out about ordinary conditions. However she comes under threat from an anarchist. ==Cast== * Zena Dare as Tilda * Mary Odette as Celia Ridler * Lionelle Howard as Seaton Ridler * Randle Ayrton as I. Azreal * Roy Travers as Sir Charles Pounds * Charles Danvers as Sir Marmaduke Ridler * James McWilliams as Stubbs * Peggy Bayfield as Nance ==References== ==Bibliography== * Low, Rachael. History of the British Film, 1918-1929. George Allen & Unwin, 1971. ==External links== * Category:1921 films Category:1921 drama films Category:British films Category:British silent feature films Category:British drama films Category:English-language films Category:Films directed by Kenelm Foss Category:Films based on British novels Category:Films set in England Category:British black-and-white films
title: No. 5 John Street
